response.original_title: Arizona Infrastructure Guide: Resolving TotalAV "High Disk Usage" & Thermal Spikes
response.overview: Arizona Antivirus Helpline: 1-855-508-8955 Technical Root Cause Analysis: Arizona users frequently report TotalAV causing 100% Disk Usage. Technically, this is an MFT (Master File Table) conflict. TotalAVâ€™s "Smart Scan" attempts to index every file handle on the drive. In Arizona's high-heat environments, this intense I/O causes Thermal Throttling, where the hardware slows down significantly to prevent melting, leading to a completely frozen system. Advanced Restoration Protocols: MFT Optimization: Run chkdsk /f to repair file table inconsistencies that slow down the scan engine. I/O Scheduling Override: Change the TotalAV scan priority to "Idle" via the advanced configuration menu to reduce stress. Temp Cache Purge: Delete the AppData\Local\Temp contents to remove "Scanning Traps" that cause the 100% disk loop.
